section.heading: Purposes of chapter.

content.p: To encourage and provide financial assistance to counties in the establishment and development of mental health services, including services to persons with intellectual disabilities and persons with developmental disabilities, through locally controlled community mental health programs. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

To promote the improvement and, if necessary, the expansion of already existing services which help to conserve the mental health of the people of Nevada. It is the intent of this chapter that services to individuals be rendered only upon voluntary application.

section.heading: Definitions.

content.p: ï¿½County boardï¿½ means a county mental health advisory board. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½County directorï¿½ means the director of a county program. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½County programï¿½ means a county community mental health program. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Governing bodyï¿½ means the board of county commissioners. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
ï¿½Serviceï¿½ means a mental health service.

section.heading: Responsibility of Department for developing and administering preventive and other services for mental health.

content.p: Assisting and consulting with local health authorities, local governments and all law enforcement agencies in this State in providing community mental health services, which services may include prevention, rehabilitation, case finding, diagnosis and treatment of persons with mental illness, and consultation and education for groups and individuals regarding mental health. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Coordinating mental health functions with other state agencies. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Participating in and promoting the development of facilities for training personnel necessary for implementing such services. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Collecting and disseminating information pertaining to mental health. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Performing such other acts as are necessary to promote mental health in the State.

section.heading: Administration by Division; standards and regulations governing county programs.

content.p: The Division shall, subject to the supervision of the Commission, administer this chapter. The Commission shall adopt guidelines for county programs and regulations necessary thereto, but these standards and regulations must be adopted only after consultation with and approval of the county director of each program being so administered. These standards and regulations must support and maximize local responsibility for and control of county programs within the framework of general guidelines.

section.heading: Power of county to establish program.

content.p: The governing body of any county may by ordinance or resolution establish a county community mental health program which may cover the entire area of the county.

section.heading: County mental health advisory board: Composition; terms of members.

content.p: The county program shall have a county mental health advisory board of 7 to 15 members appointed by the governing body. The composition of the county board shall be representative of providers of mental health services, recipients or consumers of mental health services, agencies and occupations having a working involvement with mental health services and the general public, but such representation need not be in any fixed proportion. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The term of each member of the advisory board shall be for 3 years, but of the members first appointed approximately one-third shall be appointed for a term of 1 year, one-third for a term of 2 years and one-third for a term of 3 years.

section.heading: County board: Duties.

content.p: Review and evaluate communitiesï¿½ needs, services, facilities and special problems in the fields of mental health, intellectual disabilities and developmental disabilities. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Advise the governing body as to programs of community mental health services and facilities and services to persons with intellectual disabilities and persons with developmental disabilities and, when requested by the governing body, make recommendation regarding the appointment of a county director. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
After adoption of a program, continue to act in an advisory capacity to the county director.

section.heading: County director: Appointment.

content.p: The county board, with the approval of a majority of the governing body, shall appoint a county director, who must be a person professionally qualified in the field of psychiatric mental health. The choice of appointing a physician or one who is not a physician rests with the county board, and in making such choice the county board shall consider the duties that the county director is expected to perform.

section.heading: County director: Duties.

content.p: Serve as chief executive officer of the county program and be accountable to the county board. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Exercise administrative responsibility and authority over the county program and facilities furnished, operated or supported in connection therewith, and over services to persons with intellectual disabilities or persons with developmental disabilities, except as administrative responsibility is otherwise provided for in this title. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Recommend to the governing body, after consultation with the county board, the providing of services, establishment of facilities, contracting for services or facilities and other matters necessary or desirable to accomplish the purposes of this chapter. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Submit an annual report to the governing body reporting all activities of the program, including a financial accounting of expenditures and a forecast of anticipated needs for the ensuing year. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Carry on such studies as may be appropriate for the discharge of his or her duties, including the control and prevention of psychiatric disorders and the treatment of intellectual disabilities and developmental disabilities.

section.heading: Establishment of joint community programs by counties.

content.p: The governing body of any county may by agreement with the governing body or bodies of any other county or counties establish joint community mental health programs.

section.heading: Agreement for joint program: Provisions.

content.p: Any agreement between two or more counties for the establishment of joint county programs shall provide: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That each county shall bear its share of the cost of the joint county program in proportion to the population of each county served. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

That the county treasurer of one participating county shall be the custodian of moneys made available for the purposes of such joint program and that the county treasurer may make payments from such moneys upon warrant of the appropriate officer or body of the county for which he or she is county treasurer. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any such agreement may also provide: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

For the joint provision and operation of services and facilities or for the provision and operation of services and facilities by one participating county under contract for the other participating counties. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For appointments of members of the board for the joint program by the several participating counties. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
That for specified purposes officers and employees of such joint county programs shall be considered to be officers and employees of one participating county only. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
For such other matters as are necessary or proper to effectuate the purposes of this chapter.

section.heading: Provisions of chapter applicable to joint programs.

content.p: Unless otherwise expressly provided or required by the context, the provisions of this chapter relating to county community mental health programs and the appointment of county boards or county directors shall apply to joint county programs.

section.heading: Contract with hospital, clinic, laboratory or other institution.

content.p: The county director may, with the approval of a majority of the governing body, contract for services and facilities with any hospital, clinic, laboratory or other similar institution.

section.heading: Expenses: Charge against county.

content.p: The expenses incurred under the provisions of this chapter shall be a charge against the county and shall be audited, levied, collected and paid in the same manner as other charges.

section.heading: Legislative appropriations; payment of claims.

content.p: Funds to carry out the provisions of this chapter shall be provided by direct legislative appropriation from the General Fund. Such funds shall be expended in accordance with the allotment, transfer, work program and budget provisions ofNRS 353.150to353.246, inclusive, and transfers to and from salary allotments, travel allotments, operating expense allotments, equipment allotments, and other allotments shall be allowed and made in accordance with the provisions ofNRS 353.215to353.225, inclusive, and after separate consideration of the merits of each request. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
All moneys in any fund available to the Division for carrying out the provisions of this chapter shall be paid out on claims approved by the Administrator as other claims against the State are paid.

section.heading: Reimbursement by State for expenditures by county.

content.p: Expenditures made by counties for county programs, including services to persons with intellectual disabilities or persons with developmental disabilities, pursuant to this chapter must be reimbursed by the State pursuant toNRS 433C.270to433C.350, inclusive.

section.heading: Services included in county program.

content.p: A service operated within a county program must be directed to at least one of the following mental health areas: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Mental illness; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Intellectual disabilities; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Developmental disabilities; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Organic brain and other neurological impairment; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Alcohol or other substance use disorders. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A service is any of the following: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Diagnostic service; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Emergency service; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Inpatient service; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Habilitation or rehabilitation service; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Prevention, consultation, collaboration, education or information service; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Any other service approved by the Division.

section.heading: Eligibility for reimbursement: Requirements.

content.p: Establish one or more of the services provided for inNRS 433C.270. In-service training necessary to providing such services shall be proper items of expenditures subject to state reimbursement. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Annually submit to the Administrator a plan for proposed expenditures. The Administrator shall review such plan to determine compliance with standards established in this chapter and fix the amount subject to state reimbursement. Existing services may qualify pursuant to the provisions of this chapter for reimbursement upon determination by the county board that such services shall be subject to and administered under the provisions of this chapter.

section.heading: Reimbursement for expenditures for certain items; investigation and audit of expenditures.

content.p: Expenditures incurred for the items specified inNRS 433C.270shall be subject to reimbursement in accordance with the regulations of the Division whether incurred by direct or joint operation of such services, by contracting for such services or by other arrangement pursuant to the provisions of this chapter. The Administrator may make such investigations and audits of such expenditures as the Administrator may deem necessary.

section.heading: Amount of reimbursement; disbursements through Division.

content.p: Money provided by direct legislative appropriation for purposes of reimbursement as provided byNRS 433C.260to433C.290, inclusive, must be allotted to the governing body as follows: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The State shall pay to each county a sum equal to 90 percent of the total proposed expenditures as reflected by the plan of proposed expenditures submitted pursuant toNRS 433C.280if the county has complied with the provisions of paragraph
. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

Before payment under this subsection, the governing body of a county must submit evidence to the Administrator that 10 percent of the total proposed expenditures have been raised and budgeted by the county for the establishment or maintenance of a county program. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

All state and federal moneys appropriated or authorized for the promotion of mental health or for services to persons with intellectual disabilities or persons with developmental disabilities in the State of Nevada must be disbursed through the Division in accordance with the provisions of this chapter and rules and regulations adopted in accordance therewith.

section.heading: Reimbursement for joint programs.

content.p: Where counties have established joint county programs, expenditures subject to reimbursement are the prorated expenditures of such counties as provided by the agreement establishing the joint program.

section.heading: Expenditures subject to reimbursement; reimbursement prohibited for certain expenditures.

content.p: Expenditures subject to reimbursement include: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Expenditures for the items specified inNRS 433C.270; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Salaries of personnel; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Operation, maintenance and service costs; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Such other expenditures as may be approved by the Administrator. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Reimbursement may not be made for: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Expenditures for capital improvements; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The purchase or construction of buildings; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Compensation to members of a county board, except for actual and necessary expenses incurred in the performance of official duties; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Expenditures incurred for court procedures under this or any other provision of law; or ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The cost of confinement of any person in excess of 90 days in any 1 calendar year. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Reimbursement may not be made to any county or counties which employ a physician in the county program who is not a lawful permanent resident of the United States.

section.heading: Claims for reimbursement.

content.p: Claims for state reimbursement shall be made in such form, at such times, and for such periods as the Administrator shall determine. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
When certified by the Administrator, claims for state reimbursement shall be presented to the State Board of Examiners.

section.heading: Fees charged according to ability to pay; limitation.

content.p: Fees for mental health services, including services to persons with intellectual disabilities or persons with developmental disabilities, rendered pursuant to an approved county plan must be charged in accordance with ability to pay, but not in excess of actual cost.

section.heading: Nevada Conference of County Community Mental Health Programs: Establishment; organization; meetings; purposes.

content.p: There is hereby established the Nevada Conference of County Community Mental Health Programs. The Division shall take appropriate steps to effectuate the establishment of the Conference as provided in this section. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

The voting membership of the Conference shall consist of the county director of each county program and one member of the county board of each county program to be chosen by such board. The nonvoting membership of the Conference shall consist of the Administrator and such other employees of the Division as the Administrator shall designate, but such employees shall be not less than two nor more than 15 in number. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½

A scheduled meeting of the Conference shall be convened at least once every 6 months. A nonscheduled meeting shall be convened upon the request of two-thirds of the voting membership. Meetings shall be called and chaired by the Administrator or the Administratorï¿½s official designee. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The Conference may organize itself in such manner and adopt such procedures as it deems appropriate. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
The purpose of the Conference is to serve as an organized forum for the discussion of the following matters: ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Recommendations for rules of the Division to implement this chapter as provided inNRS 433C.140; ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Coordination and integration of county program services and state services; and ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
Such other matters as members may bring before the Conference in connection with county programs or the relationship between county programs and the Division. ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½ï¿½
A resolution, proclamation, recommendation or similar pronouncement of the Conference does not have any legal effect.
